author: Maria Armental
title: Broadcom Profit Surges in First Report After Qualcomm Deal Withdrawal
text:
Broadcom Ltd., the Singapore-based company that spent much of the past four months attempting to acquire fellow chip maker Qualcomm Inc., on Thursday said quarterly profit surged as it booked a one-time benefit of nearly $6 billion tied to the U.S. tax overhaul.
The company, which is in the process of moving its headquarters to the U.S., formally withdrew its unsolicited bid for U.S.-based Qualcomm and its slate of nominees to Qualcomm’s board on Wednesday. The move followed President Doanld Trump’s order for Broadcom to...
